section name: 1. - Early Eocene radiolarian fauna from the Sangdanlin section in the Gyirong region, southern Tibet
locations of the boulders, samples and s: Abundant radiolarian fossils were obtained from the Sangdanlin section
Chert samples were processed for radiolarian extraction
lithology: The Sangdanlin section was mainly composed of radiolaria-bearing chert and flysches.
number of species or genera: 54 species of 30 radiolarian genera were identified
radiolarian zones: RP4-RP8 in New Zealand are comparable to the Paleocene-early Eocene radiolarian zones identified in the Sangdanlin section
age: Late Cretaceous to early Eocene, Paleocene to early Eocene, Late Campanian, Late Paleocene to early Eocene, Paleocene/Eocene boundary, no later than 53.6 Ma
biostratigraphy: Radiolarian assemblages could play an important role in biostratigraphy
The Late Cretaceous radiolarian assemblage was compared with radiolarian zonations presented by various sources
Upper Paleocene–lower Eocene deep–sea radiolarian stratigraphic and the Paleocene/ Eocene series boundary.
Upper Paleocene–Lower Eocene Radiolarian biostratigraphy of the San Francisco de Paula Section, Western Cuba: regional and global comparisons.
ecological characteristics: Radiolarian planktonic protozoa are widely distributed in oceans from the surface to the bottom
The most important ecological characteristic of the radiolaria is their vertical distribution
references: Radiolaria in Sediments from the Middle and Northern South China Sea by Chen Muhong and Tan Zhiyuan
Radiolarians in the sedimentary record by P. De Wever, P. Dumitrica, J.P. Caulet, C. Nigrini, and M. Caridroit
Paleocene deep–water sediments and radiolarian fauna: Implications for evolution of Yarlung Zangbo foreland basin, southern Tibet by Ding Lin
Latest Cretaceous to Late Paleocene radiolarian biostratigraphy: A new zonation from the New Zealand region by C.J. Hollis
Cretaceous–Paleocene Radiolarian from eastern Marlborough, New Zealand by C.J. Hollis
Biostratigraphy and paleoceanographic significance of Paleocene radiolarians from offshore eastern New Zealand by C.J. Hollis
A unified radiolarian zonation for the Late Cretaceous and Paleocene of Japan by C.J. Hollis and K. Kimura.
Cretaceous-Paleogene radiolarian fauna in Saga-Zhongba, southwestern Tibet
Upper Paleocene radiolarians from the Yamdrok melange, south Xizang (Tibet), China
Cenozoic radiolaria in the western North Atlantic, Site 603, Leg 93 of the Deep Sea Drilling Project
Paleocene radiolarian biostratigraphy in the northwest Atlantic at Site 384, Leg 43, of the Deep Sea Drilling Project
Radiolarian zonation and stratigraphy of the Upper Cretaceous portion of the Great Balley Sequence, California Coast Ranges.
Radiolaria, Leg 4, Deep Sea Drilling project.
Cenozoic Radiolaria from the western tropical Pacific, Leg 7.
Cenozoic Radiolaria (exclusive of theoperids, artostrobiids and amphipyndacids) from the Gulf of Mexico, DSDP Leg 10.
